text:
Question: is `frule` actually used somewhere or is it mainly for "the next forward-mode package" if such a thing was to ever come?
My question is motivated by whether or not it's possible to write custom `frule`  that can actually be used somewhere since, AFAIK, it's nontrivial to write custom rules for vector functions in ForwardDiff.jl (if at all possible).

elements.text:

text:
It’s used in FowardDiff2.jl, but ForwardDiff2.jl is on hiatus.
(I am also not sure if ForwardDiff2 is compatible with current version of ChainRulesCore.)

elements.text:
It’s used in FowardDiff2.jl, but ForwardDiff2.jl is on hiatus.
(I am also not sure if ForwardDiff2 is compatible with current version of ChainRulesCore.)

text:
Ah aight; this was the state of things last time I checked but was curious if something had updated. Thanks!

Also, am I correct in understanding that defining custom pushforward in ForwardDiff.jl is, ehmm, nontrivial, if at all possible?

text:
It’s is possible, at least for functions of scalars. I think <@U6788D83U> has a write up on it somewhere.
Really should get that added to the docs

text: It’s very inefficient, and it’s only a pedagogical example.
